required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of IXT-m200
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Single-Dose Intravenous Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of IXT-m200 in Healthy Participants

brief_summary.textblock: Approximately 9 participants will be enrolled in the study in a single cohort. Participants will be randomized to 3 g IXT-m200 or placebo at 7:2. Each will receive their dose as a 30-min intravenous infusion, then remain at the study site overnight to complete Day 1 and Day 2 assessments (e.g., electrocardiogram (ECG), laboratory assessments, blood draws, and vital signs). Following discharge on Day 2, participants will return to the clinic for follow-up pharmacokinetic (PK) and safety assessments on Day 8, then every 1-3 weeks thereafter until Day 127.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events (AEs) assessed by physical examinations
Number of participants with treatment-related AEs assessed by vital signs
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure, heart rate, and temperature

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related AEs assessed by ECG
Number of participants with treatment-related AEs assessed by clinical laboratory testing

arm_group.description: 3 g of IXT-m200 given once by 30-min intravenous infusion

patient_data.ipd_description: Final datasets are expected to contain pharmacokinetic data on IXT-m200 and safety data. No individually identifiable private information will be distributed.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: These datasets will be available for distribution following submission to the FDA of the Clinical Study Report and publication. They will be available for 2 years after the initial publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: These datasets and associated documentation will be made available on CD by the Sponsor to requestors under a data sharing agreement that provides for: (1) a commitment to using the data only for research purposes; (2) a commitment to securing the data using appropriate computer technology and not distributing to third parties; and (3) a commitment to destroying or returning the data after analyses are completed. Requests should be sent to intervexion@gmail.com.
